website_summaries.verdict: The Saucony Zealot ISO is a popular running shoe that many runners have come to enjoy. It looks great and it functions well, making it a superb choice for daily exercises and training. Given all the positive praises, the shoe is indeed considered by wearers as a dependable running shoe.
pros: The ISOFIT comfortable sleeve provides stretchable, breathable and comfortable coverage
Many runners appreciated the diverse color options for the Zealot ISO as it broadens the appeal
The moderately light weight of this shoe was welcomed by reviewers
The PWRGRID+ underfoot platform offers 20% more cushioning that’s durable and responsive
A support frame holds the heel in place while giving it structure, noted a handful of runners
Durable rubber is found on the outsole and it gives effective traction for the wearer
cons: For some of the testers, the upper got easily torn after a few uses
Some criticized the rear section of the upper because it was too tight for them
The Zealot ISO has an expensive price tag

customer_reviews.title: These shoes fit like a glove
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit like a glove. As soon as you put them, you want to run...and run fast. They are extremely light weight. The only thing I don't love about them is that they are advertised as max cushioned on Saucony's website (which I'm sure they are), but they do feel a bit firm, so not sure how I'll feel about them on my longer runs (over 8-10 miles), but for any shorter, faster runs I would definitely recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: paul f

customer_reviews.title: Best Running Shoe Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoe ever! I tend to supinate when I run outside or on the treadmill. I've tried Nike, Mizuno and Adidas and Saucony is overall the best running shoe. I have wide feet so recommend going half-size larger to have ample space in the toe-box; if not, you're feet will hurt. They provide responsive for me when I run on the sidewalk and on the road. Also, they're very breathable when running long-distance (>3miles). I would recommend these shoes to any avid runner or naive runner.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Yes, these are great.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, they are a bit sticky at first, but they do wear in as you wear them. I have never been a runner and probably never will, but these are amazing on my feet. They are lightweight and breathable. The cushion on the soul is soft and relaxing when I run. I definitely would recommend these to anyone starting out. I have not raced or anything in them, and not sure if I would as I have not had them very long, but I have done roughly 15 miles in them, and they are holding up well and they seem to be the shoe everyone has been talking about on here. Definitely say yes to these.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Cloud 9
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! I think they are the best running shoes I have ever owned. Fit appears to be true to size. The cushioning on these shoes is incredible with no break in required right out of the box. I have already ordered and received a second pair and am considering purchasing another before they go extinct.
customer_reviews.author: B. Shotts

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable and lightweight running shoes I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes, these are my second pair and they are the most comfortable and light weight running shoes I have ever owned. I wear them running and when I will be on my feet all day. I have a medium arch in both feet and a slightly wider foot and these things fit my feet perfectly. I they are so comfortable that my wife just bought a pair because i rave about them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: kyle love

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of toe wiggle room and secure/snug (as a good thing) at the arch and heel
customer_reviews.text: Generally I buy Asics Cumulus to run in. Since I needed to replace them I thought I would try these. I buy a neutral shoe. I wear a size 10 in the Ascis and ordered these in size 10. The fit is different. It feels right. Plenty of toe wiggle room and secure/snug (as a good thing) at the arch and heel. They seem lighter and cushier than the Asics. I don't get hotspots or have any heal issues when I run in these. My new favorite shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: and so comfortable. Walked 5 miles my first day
customer_reviews.text: Changed to the Saucony from the Asics since Asics changed their fit and comfort. No break-in necessary, and so comfortable. Walked 5 miles my first day. Goodbye Asics
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Bought these a few weeks ago and have really enjoyed running in them
customer_reviews.text: Bought these a few weeks ago and have really enjoyed running in them. I love the support and cushion and I am a large guy clunking around out on the trails. So far I love these shoes.. the look and feel is awesome. At first I was concerned about the material that is part of the Saucony logo on the shoe because it is not fully attached to the shoe, but these feel incredible and look good and get my butt out there running which is a really good thing.. Gonna strap em on right now and attempt to conquer the world... one step at a time.
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: My husband has a wide foot and wore New Balance ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a wide foot and wore New Balance for many years. He tried the Saucony and loves them. Saw this pair on sale and ordered it so now he has two pair. He's big into walking and using the treadmill so his shoe choices are very important.
customer_reviews.author: Dolly

customer_reviews.title: mainly on asphalt and I need a good comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are my third pair of Zealot shoes. I don't run, but do some serious walking, mainly on asphalt and I need a good comfortable shoe. One pair completely worn out, another pair half way gone, when I found these on Amazon deal of the day, at about half what I had paid for the others on Zappos. I hated to find them there, as I figure that means they will be/ have been discontinued. I immediately bought a pair to set back as replacements for the ones I am currently wearing.
customer_reviews.author: Rexell1951

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hybrid of minimalist and distance comfort
customer_reviews.text: As a fan of Saucony's Kinvara and Vitarra I discovered these looking for a little more comfort for longer distance training without sacrificing the light weight and near zero toe to heel profile of those shoes, not to mention a little more durability. After putting over 300 miles on my first pair (which I still wear regularly) I bought a second pair of the first version that I expect to wear for at least 300 miles. If you're looking for a solid distance shoe for training or racing that is still light and fast this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt E.

customer_reviews.title: Was having problems with my Ultra Torins, and Merrell ...
customer_reviews.text: Was having problems with my Ultra Torins, and Merrell Mix Master II's on my long runs. Especially my Ultra Torins where I was having blister problems between my toes and just at the tip on my midfoot behind big toe plus pain just foward of ankle by tongue of shoe. Switched to the Zealot Iso a month before my marathon. Thank god, even with a massive downpoor and soaked feet right at the start of the OC Marathon, a completed my first marathon without any blisters.
customer_reviews.author: 5150rwj

customer_reviews.title: good shoe for money
customer_reviews.text: So far only 1 run in shoes, overall quite happy, only dislike is arch support basically terrible. But fairly comfortable for a 5 mile run. Will be doing a longer run this weekend so will see how lack of arch support effects things. But very comfortable for the short run, was surprised at how good it felt after noticing the lack of arch support while breaking in the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: louis saragusa

customer_reviews.title: 5 and they fit perfect and super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've been running in Saucony Cohesion 5s for sometime now but found a deal on these. In the Cohesion 5 I wear a 11.5 and they fit perfect and super comfortable. I had to go up to a 12 in these and they are still a little narrow in the toe. I should have gone with a wide but these will do until the next pair. It's still a great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: flyrod

customer_reviews.title: Your feet deserve comfort
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I had tried a pair of sauconys, different shoe but same brand, loved them then and loving this particular pair even more. Best running shoe I have ever tried. Great support and amazing cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Lover

customer_reviews.title: ... I've ran four times with them and they feel great. Nice and lite but still have good support
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the shoes for one week but I've ran four times with them and they feel great. Nice and lite but still have good support. Probably the most comfortable shoe I've ran in. UPDATE: I'm up to about 500 miles on these shoes and I have no issues. This has been a great shoe and I'm thinking of buying another pair. I usually change shoes after 500 miles so I think it's about that time.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Moll

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: So far these are great shoes at a great price. Before I bought these, I was running in an older pair of Saucony Cohesion 7's. I just ordered the same size and these new ones fit great. I ran a 1/2 marathon yesterday with no issues whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Lantz

customer_reviews.title: Another great shoe from Saucony
customer_reviews.text: Very nice shoes. I love the fit of Saucony and have been buying them for years. These are exactly as I expected them to be. I've received several compliments on them as well. I purchased the orange ones.
customer_reviews.author: Wdimike

customer_reviews.title: if you are seeking a running shoes having good cushion with light weight
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying more than 20 pairs of major brands on the market, if you are seeking a running shoes having good cushion with light weight, as well as comfortable, this one definitely should on the top of list. I will buy another one no doubt
customer_reviews.author: Jacky

customer_reviews.title: New favorite shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to try I place of the Kinvaras 4&5s I've been wearing the past few years. I'm glad I did, they fit/feel much like the Kinvaras to me, don't weigh much more (don't notice a difference) and have an even plusher feel to me. Having said all that, I'm an underpronator (supinator), mid-foot striker so I need a neutral shoe like this and I'm hoping the small amount of added rubber to the sole increases the long-term wear of this shoe. That's really why I bought them in the first place, but other than a lower stack height I really couldn't recommend them more if you need a neutral shoe and/or like the Kinvaras.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable right out of the box. Really like the iso-fit bootie construction, no tongue to position or maneuver. First impression on the run, one of about 6 miles, was pleasant surprise. A thick responsive sole, firm under foot, yet not so firm that I couldn't feel the strike. My gut tells me these will take another 40 or so miles to soften up to their max cushion potential. I post an update at that point with a final conclusion.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Gordon

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome! I would buy again in a heartbeat!!
customer_reviews.text: These are a amazingly comfortable. I have big, wide feet and they seem to fit true to size I wear a men's 11. Nice wide toe box. I wear Saucony running shoes for my neuropathy and foot pain. I do not have as much pain in my legs or feet because of how well their shoes are made.
customer_reviews.author: Bludreams34

customer_reviews.title: The extra cushioning is nice and they are very breathable
customer_reviews.text: Maybe they just need stretched out, but after one 5miler, it is clear that the toebox is tighter than the Kinvaras. Although, a half size up would probably be too big. The extra cushioning is nice and they are very breathable. Definitely built better than the Kinvara. Overall, a good running shoe. We'll have to see how they hold up to 10+milers.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony_525

customer_reviews.title: Not a Cortana replacement.
customer_reviews.text: I have ran in Cortanas for years, since the first one came out. Love the shoe. Now they've discontinued it. I read reviews about these, people comparing them to Cortanas, so I got a pair. A few runs and I feel horrible. Completely different fit and feel. Different muscles and joints at work while running in these. I'm in pain all over. Comfortable for walking and light. But for running for someone who has run in Cortanas these are bad. Will have to pay full price for older Coranas. Need a worthy replacement, and these are not it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Artur K.

customer_reviews.title: Shoe felt great from the get-go. Love Saucony ISO Zealot shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit great, like the previous ones I have owned. I've used all three versions (original like this one, 2, 3) and all fit well and minimize soreness as a runner. The feet issues I've had in the past are not an issue with these shoes. Comfort running at its finest!
customer_reviews.author: Davin Ashbury

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Fit is great with a sizable toe box. Use these for distance running and they provide great cushion while remaining quite light. Bright neon color is as bright as the sun. Seven people considered running me down on the road but reconsidered because of the neon majesty that enveloped my feet.
customer_reviews.author: AHoward

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of Saucony shoes and I'm very happy with them. Traditionally I wear Adidas as they are very consistent with their sizing. I have a very wide foot for how small they are and it's hard for me to find shoes that fit. The only thing that would make them perfect would be if they came in a wider size. With that being said, they still feel great!
customer_reviews.author: KORM

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for a big guy
customer_reviews.text: writing from my wife's account.... Best running shoe I've ran in. Lightest shoe with stability that I have used. Love the Nike Airs but for a 6'9" 260lb runner that needs a shoe that's light, stable and comfortable this shoe is spot on. Will have a 100 miles on them by next week and they feel great the whole run. FYI...I do have custom insoles from Road Runner Sports. I will buy these shoes again!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda R Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes. Good fit and comfort. I'm used to using trail runners and these don't have that level of support but after about 50 miles of running they still feel pretty good. Very light weight and solid comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: I have narrow feet so it is hard to find a good running shoe that fits snugly and grips my heel. These shoes are great, I have put 100+ miles on them over the last few weeks and have no complaints. There is a lot of cushioning on the heel and the shoe is very breathable.
customer_reviews.author: ScurvyMeg

customer_reviews.title: these are my 2nd favorite shoes i have ever run in
customer_reviews.text: i run about 60 miles per month for more than 10 years. these are my 2nd favorite shoes i have ever run in. it is a continual problem to find a great shoe, and then the company revises them and they no longer feel the same. i ordered these to augment another pair i have exactly like them that i now have about 250 miles on.
customer_reviews.author: redfearn teal

customer_reviews.title: These top all the other shoes I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Have had the Saucony Cortana 3's and felt like they were the best running shoes I've owned. I would say that my Zealot ISOs top even those. I have a history of knee problems/IT band tightness and find that these shoes do an excellent job of providing good support.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Stevenson III

customer_reviews.title: Superior cushioning; extra room
customer_reviews.text: I love Saucony shoes in general mainly due to the extra room in the toe box and their stability. I have tried several different type of running shoes and keep coming back to Saucony. These shoes in particular offer nice room for a wider foot and toe box, nice stability and superior cushioning. I am a 'heavy' older runner, so for me the cushioning is major reason I purchased this shoe and I am glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin Bruce

customer_reviews.title: So light and comfortable that I bought two spares!
customer_reviews.text: These Sauconys are so light and comfortable that I bought 2 extra pairs before they aren't available any longer. Not only are they great for road running, but I wear them for every day comfort as well. I recently walked over 140 miles through 8 different countries in Europe and they still look and feel almost new.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L

customer_reviews.title: ... was not available but the fit and performance was perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My preferred color was not available but the fit and performance was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not their best
customer_reviews.text: I love Saucony shoes but there is a flaw in this one. Where the tongue is connected to the shoe by toe box area the extra material folds inwards and cuts into your feet pretty good. The shoe has great cushioning, but hard to get past the uncomfort of the top area. I'll use them for shorter easy 6-10 mile runs but not for anything longer.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not for narrow feet
customer_reviews.text: If you have wide feet, especially in the toe box, these might work for you. However, since I don't, they don't work for me. My toes splay out when I'm running and the rub in all the wrong spots.
customer_reviews.author: RC394958

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for heel strikers
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. I ran the Marine Corps Marathon in them and have bought multiple pairs for marathon training. I'm a heel-striker and the offset on these shoes really helped with that. I had some mild back-pain from running, but these shoes really helped to minimize that with it's plush cushioning. It's hard to find a pair of running shoes that have Cadillac cushioning but remain on the lower end of the range for weight of running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Nella S

customer_reviews.title: A nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable, I love running in these. The color is nice too, it helps you be seen from far away. A great trainer that should be able to handle a lot of miles.
customer_reviews.author: MightyVandal

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. Very comfortable so far
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Very comfortable so far. I like the iso fit feature - it hugs my foot but doesn't hurt the top of my feet, as other shoes have. The real test will be this weekend's marathon.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Jones

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of walking and had been having some bad pain with another famous brand (which I have used for over 35 years). These solved all problems and I am in comfort again, so glad I found these. Their size guide was quite complete and works. They have a great comfort padding and thickness. I am impressed and will soon be buying additional pairs. Great colors too.
customer_reviews.author: Foxboy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t believe everything you read
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they were described as the answer to ball of foot pain. After 4 hours of wear my feet were throbbing!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Needless to say i like them. this was slightly smaller than others i ...
customer_reviews.text: i have run exclusively in Saucony for over 35 years. Needless to say i like them. this was slightly smaller than others i have worn but its light and a very nice shoe. And it wasn't too small. I suspect it will wear more quickly in the upper toe area because of the snug fit and less durable upper (probably contributes to the light weight). i would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: PeggyL

customer_reviews.title: Great Light Weight Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Advised & I ordered 1/2 size larger than normal and they fit perfect....slight wider toe box....arch could be slightly higher..... cushioned ride on shorter runs... could be used for faster paced workouts or races..
customer_reviews.author: 1500runner

customer_reviews.title: Another great pair of Sacuony shoes
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfect and were comfortable to exercise in right out of the box. I have been a pleased customer for 10+ years,=.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Convert
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of Saucony running shoes after being a loyal Asic gel customer. I am now a convert. These are more supportive in the arch and allow for more toe splay during running. I do not know how they will perform on the road since I do all my running on a treadmill but for genuine comfort they are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get a half size larger, somewhat small
customer_reviews.text: I really like this shoe, It has a great look and the build quality is exceptional. I was looking for the Cortana, but this is the replacement. It feels a little firm compared to my Kinvaras. The sizing is about a half size off. I had to send back the size 9 and get a 9.5.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Dawson

customer_reviews.title: A running shoe through and through, this light weight number is meant for straight mid-distance runs
customer_reviews.text: It's wide toe box makes this show comfortable and minimalist in feel. The 4mm heel-to-toe is perfect for neutral runners who only need moderate arch support. The colors are vibrant enough but not too gaudy. Buy this shoe if you are a mid distance runner, because its not meant for the abuse of trail running, sprinting, or the constant wear and tear of long distance training.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ruggieri

customer_reviews.title: Better than my Brooks
customer_reviews.text: These are zero drop...so arch is not happening. When I first tried on, they felt a tad snug, but once I started walking on them they fit like a glove. After extensive workout (cardio & weights) my feet felt great...no numbing, no pain...just really good. I really like these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: CharlestonCasual

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit
customer_reviews.text: So good I bought the same sneakers (different color) again
customer_reviews.author: Carlos L Nieves

customer_reviews.title: Great running trainers.
customer_reviews.text: Size fits me about right. I normally wear 11.5 or 12, and I got these in a 12 and they fit well. Overall, I love the shoes so far. I've only had two runs, about 15 miles total, but they are great so far. I tend to like lower or no rise, but these have more cushion than most of those types of shoes, so they are great for training. I still really like my Virratas but these will be nice for longer training runs. I have a marathon coming up in 2 weeks and I'm really debating if these will be broken in enough to wear them for it by then.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Decent shoe - not sure if will last long term
customer_reviews.text: Needs 3.5 stars. Functionally the shoes are good. Fit is great and the appearance for the most part is pretty cool. Nice bright colors! The only thing I can say about them that I don't really like is the "flash/swoop" thing on the side looks like a cheap plastic iron on. Actually a lot of the sides look plastic. Up close it doesn't really say "quality material used in assembly". I have only had them for a short time so we will see if they last long term.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only put one run in so far and that was ...
customer_reviews.text: Only put one run in so far and that was only for 2.5 miles. They're a little more snug than my Pearl Izumi N2V2, but those also are broken in with 200+ running miles and near every day wear. I have hopes for these as they break in.
customer_reviews.author: IP

customer_reviews.title: These are great shoes for at least this beginning runner
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes for at least this beginning runner. They are super cool with the neon colors and I could really tell the difference from my Nike Free Runs with the level of padding. I will admit I had Nike brand bias until I kept getting bad shin splints and a bad hip flexor, but after switching to a more padded shoe like the Saucony Zealot I have experienced far less discomfort during my runs. My only problem is with the inside sole being all yellow vs. the outside having the cool fade to black however that is strictly aesthetic and doesn't really affect how much I like running in this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Steve James

customer_reviews.title: My first pair of road shoes in a few years...
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of road shoes in a few years. I've been wearing the Saucony Peregrine and Xodus trail shoes for a while. Their road shoes seem to be just as good. Super comfortable. Good fit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Not as much forefoot cushioning as the Corteza model shoe ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as much forefoot cushioning as the Corteza model shoe which sadly Saucony discontinued. I can't run in these for that reason so I'll just use them for other activities. Color is highly visible at night.
customer_reviews.author: Milkweed

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Spectacular ones. Love the "your floating" feeling. Very nice for running. Easy to wear. This are my first Saucony, but I'm now a huge fan. Next time I'll buy half size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo G. Cardey

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my foot very well. I have a somewhat narrow heel in relation to my toebox. Extremely light. Really meant for road or track surfaces, not trail running, fyi. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J-Utah

customer_reviews.title: Fit on my foot feels great and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected, but I usually wear them a couple of times before I attempt to run in shoes. Fit on my foot feels great and comfortable. The color is really bright, but for the price it was a great deal for me... other reviewers have ran marathons in this type of shoe, so my 4-6 mile run should be great...
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Brambl

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for under-pronators. Provides great support for under-pronators and is very light.
customer_reviews.author: tC

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoe. Lightweight with decent support
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe. Lightweight with decent support. I am an average runner, 2 to 3 miles a day, and these are very comfortable. You hardly feel the upper half of the shoe when running.
customer_reviews.author: allan

customer_reviews.title: Good low drop running show
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these strictly for running. Because I am a forefoot/midfoot runner, I need a shoe with no or little drop from heel to toe. These shoes have a 4mm drop, similar to the Nike Free Rn distance, which these shoes are replacing. The Free did not have much toe box room and gave me blisters. So far these shoes have been great. They fit exactly as I would expect, there is sufficient room in the toe box, and there is decent cushioning. I'll probably buy a second pair of these before they are no longer available due to the next generation of this model already being sold.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri H.

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the Kinvara
customer_reviews.text: Not as comfortable as the Kinvara, and a little too mushy on the cushioning when running. Felt bogged down. Also seems to run smaller than the Kinvara. For the price though,this is a decent shoe.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: I found the perfect running shoe for me
customer_reviews.text: Love this running shoe. Great support, lightweight, comfortable, and lasts a long time. On my second pair. Highly recommend for anyone to try.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Biodrowski

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoe for a very short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe except for a huge fail: toes quickly make punctures into the fabric as it is super light but not that resistant.
customer_reviews.author: German H.

customer_reviews.title: Had to super glue it back on
customer_reviews.text: The edges of the sole on the soles started peeling off within a few weeks. Had to super glue it back on. I had the Glide 7 before and the insole is much firmer. This one have more of a memory foam feel and bit too soft for my neuroma. Otherwise it very comfortable and the color gets lots of attention or compliment
customer_reviews.author: Pussy Galore

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe! This is my second time buying this ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe! This is my second time buying this model. The next model Zealot is out, but why buy the new model when you can buy this one at half the price it used to be?
customer_reviews.author: C. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Fan
customer_reviews.text: I am very much a Saucony fan as I own several pairs. The ISO Zealot are fantastic. Makes me want to run (and I hate running!). But work out and jog at a very brisk. And these shoes feel terrific and provide great support with a nice bounce. Definitely recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel F Tomaino

customer_reviews.title: nice shoe iam 68 year old and someone told me ...
customer_reviews.text: nice shoe iam 68 year old and someone told me old people don't ware that kind of shoe iam 68 years old in age but 40 at hart I still ware them
customer_reviews.author: charles payne

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for the price. Have bought more expensive shoes and they weren't as comfortable as these right off the bat. Immediately went for a 5-mile jog and experienced no discomfort or pain in knees or feet.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel C. Molina

customer_reviews.title: Run small, not good for bigger dudes
customer_reviews.text: Small, so order a size bigger. If you're over 225 lbs, I'd consider another brand.
customer_reviews.author: C J

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Walking Shoes
customer_reviews.text: A marathon runner friend recommended this brand and when the pair arrived I tried it on and walked 6.7 miles to the beach and back. My feet felt happy and little pain in my leg muscles. They feel like walking on high quality memory foam. Great product n
customer_reviews.author: Agyaaku

customer_reviews.title: LIght Trainers
customer_reviews.text: Lighter than the ride, and a little more cushion than the Kinvara's that I wear for races and speed training, Yet to do a long run, but I think that I'll like these.
customer_reviews.author: Dick C

customer_reviews.title: Replace my worn out tennis shoe !
customer_reviews.text: It's too late to return these tennis shoes , but I properly maintained them , walked on sidewalks and the normal use , but the heel and toe parts wore out already ! Please have this company replace these with size 11 . Less than 6 months use . Caring about my feet , Joe M . at joemettler@yahoo.com
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I went through some major foot pain for about 2-3 ...
customer_reviews.text: I went through some major foot pain for about 2-3 months and realized I needed much more support out of my jogging shoe. Once I started wearing these my pain went away and I threw out the Nikes & Pumas I had been wearing.
customer_reviews.author: sikulas

customer_reviews.title: I have another pair of Saucony and though this is ...
customer_reviews.text: I have another pair of Saucony and though this is also a size 11 it is just ever so slightly a looser fit. But, I don't believe a 1/2 size smaller is called for!
customer_reviews.author: Mr BILL

customer_reviews.title: A Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I run for fitness, but not much more than 20-40 minutes a day on the treadmill. With that in mind, I can say this about these shoes: - They are very comfortable to wear, when running, lifting weights, or just walking around - The footbed feels pretty firm until you start running on them, then they begin to feel very supportive. This is a quality I actually like quite a bit - They are really light. - They lace up nicely with no weird pressure points - The shoe laces they come with stay tied really well - They look hillariously bright and that's cool with me :)
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Not able to deal with the pain.
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this pair of shoes. I have purchased many Saucony shoes in the past and was always been very happy with them. I have only worn these 5 times on a treadmill since I purchased them. My feet, legs and hips ache horribly each time. I thought that they just need to break in, however I can not bear the pain anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great long run shoe
customer_reviews.text: Personally I think these shoes are hideous. that said, they are very comfortable. They are a bit narrow in the toes, but the cushion in the sole is unreal. Super comfortable for my long runs.
customer_reviews.author: Kavri

customer_reviews.title: Jabbing Achilles.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, except for the inner heal. Both shoes have a piece of plastic or rubber jabbing into my achilles during runs. It's frustrating because the rest of the shoe is awesome and durable. These are my 3rd pair of Saucony. May look to another brand after this.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J.

customer_reviews.title: I wish I'd have bought two pairs
customer_reviews.text: Purchased by husband - Very comfortable with the wide toebox. Air has no trouble getting to my toes. The sole is firm but supportive and softens over a long run. You can wear an insole but I immediately went back to the ones that came in the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Fam

customer_reviews.title: most comfort you can buy!!
customer_reviews.text: so comfortable!! been wearing asics and new balance for a few years and so glad i went with these this time. I will definately be buying more in future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hands down one of the best running shoes I have ever owned in this price ...
customer_reviews.text: Hands down one of the best running shoes I have ever owned in this price range! If not the best! They are super light weight and look awsome too! Will have to see how long the souls hold up?
customer_reviews.author: robtwig

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these shoes. I wear them for the days we run in my Cross Fit class. We usually run the equivalent of two 5ks a week. I order men's shoes because most women's running shoes aren't offered in wide widths. (Hello, manufacturers?!) I wear men's 8.5 in these shoes, my women's size is normally 9.5-10D.
customer_reviews.author: DBEmmett

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've always gotten new balance shoes, but decided to take a chance on these. So far they're great, very very very bright orange which is a good thing running through city streets
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, albeit slightly longer
customer_reviews.text: Everyone compliments on the vibrant colors! Very comfortable, albeit slightly longer, good arch support. Use it for my HIIT and other running activities. Can't beat the discount price.
customer_reviews.author: Aski

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are great, very comfortable for running and walking
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great, very comfortable for running and walking. I would highly recommend them and other Saucony shoes they are very durable. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: pahuntr

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable...but
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, but side material wore out easily from my pinky toes and it was not a loose fit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace an identical pair I already wore out. Shipping was fast, fits the same as the original pair. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad it was suggested I go with a size larger
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad it was suggested I go with a size larger. That way the shoe being a little narrow was not to much of a problem. The more I wear them the better they feel.
customer_reviews.author: WILLDREX

customer_reviews.title: Once I figured out the lacing tightness they are good shoes.
customer_reviews.text: It was a little tight in the toes at first, but I discovered I had to lace these shoes a little looser than I do my other shoes. Once I figured out the lacing tightness they are good shoes.
customer_reviews.author: pastor

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. Due to my narrow foot
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Due to my narrow foot, AAA, noting fits well but the Saucony fits better than anything else. And I've tried them all. This is my eighth pair of Saucony.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bruce Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Very light in weight!
customer_reviews.text: Very light, fit perfectly. Would recommend and will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great workout/running shoe
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased these shoes after doing a lot of research. The price was great and he loves how they look and feel. The price was awesome and so was the shipping speed! Thank you Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: My Reviews

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and comfortable, bought my wife and kids some in other ...
customer_reviews.text: When you jog at 5am you want all the brightness possible, these are bright, lightweight and comfortable, bought my wife and kids some in other less bright colors
customer_reviews.author: Gixxxer

customer_reviews.title: Love these. One of the best saucony I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these. One of the best saucony I have had I love saucony and asics Iso triumph is also great. But I think zeolite more comfy
customer_reviews.author: Ernest S.

customer_reviews.title: I really like these. I've had multiple versions of the kinvaras ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. I've had multiple versions of the kinvaras and have recently been wearing the ISO triumphs. I run 30+ miles a week and the kinvaras just don't hold up. I like the triumphs, but something about the 8mm drop bothers my foot after 7-8 miles. These are perfect since they are a 4 mm drop, have more rubber on the sole, yet maintain a good ground feel. Really nice balance.
customer_reviews.author: simon warstler

customer_reviews.title: Great road shoe
customer_reviews.text: Wide toe box, lots of cushoning, low drop, light and fast. Great road shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Graham King

customer_reviews.title: Great support/cushioning
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes with nice, wide toe box. Some reviews have noted a firm ride, but I don't feel much difference between these and my Kinvaras, although these are slightly heavier. Overall, a great ride. These 'fit as expected', but I expected that they would run 1/2 size small (i.e., I typically wear size 12, a 12.5 in the Zealot fits great).
customer_reviews.author: Matt Stuk

customer_reviews.title: Fit a little small
customer_reviews.text: Shoes looked good but had to return them because they fit a little small. I wore Triumph's for the last 4 years. Return was super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

product_meta.title: Saucony Zealot ISO Running Shoes - 10 Black
product_meta.description: The Zealot ISO supplies maximum cushioning, minimal weight and dynamic, foot-hugging ISOFIT in a low-profile package to push you further than ever before Upper A revolution in upper construction, the Saucony Zealot ISO Running Shoes feature intelligent upper engineering, designed to work with the mechanics of the the foot throughout the gait cycle to create one of the most dynamic and adaptable fits on the market. According to the Running USA 2013 National Runner Survey, 92% of respondents surveyed selected "fit" as the most important criteria when purchasing running shoes. Capitalising on this their designers have created a revolution in fit. ISOFIT. A plush, ultra soft inner sleeve crafted from a malleable air mesh, contours to the wearers foot, creating an almost sock like feel. Binding the midfoot together and providing structural integrity the floating support cage cradles the midfoot; adapting to the foot's size, shape and movement, allowing the shoe to respond to the individual runner's gait throughout each stride. Midsole Complimenting the design and technology of ISOFIT an open toe box construction enhanced the already plush feel and delivers superior comfort. Creating a truly unique feel and experience Saucony have re engineered their PowerGrid technology, creating PWRGRID+. By adding a Powerfoam material and integrating it with GRID technology, Saucony have created a system that effectively centres the foot, absorbs impact and distributes pressure. The PWRGRID+ platform's increased stack heights deliver over 20% more cushioning and 15% more resiliency than the previous version, increasing versatility and prolonging the longevity of the shoes capabilities. The re-engineered geometry and materials work with the runners stride, maintaining a smooth and fluid transition, for an unmatched ride. Outsole Working in concert with the re-engineered PWRGRID+ technology, SRC impact zone provides durable shock absorption at impact
feature_bullets: ISOFIT - A plush, ultra soft inner sleeve crafted from a malleable air mesh, contours to the wearers foot, creating a sock like feel.
Floating Support Cage - Cradles the midfoot; adapting to the foot's size, shape and movement, allowing the shoe to respond to the individual runner's gait throughout each stride.
lightweight Support Frame - Provides the shoe with a locked in heel fit.
Open Toe Box - Further enhances the plush feel, delivering superior comfort.
PWRGRID+ - Effectively centres the foot, absorbs impact and distributes pressure. Providing 20% more cushioning.
